reasoning: To model the behavior where Human 3 checks if the robot says 'EXCUSE ME' and then gives way to the robot, we will use the `RobotSays` condition to check for the 'EXCUSE ME' gesture (gesture code 4). If the robot says 'EXCUSE ME', we will use `GiveWaytoRobot` to move Human 3 out of the robot's path. Once Human 3 is no longer close to the robot, we stop giving way. If the robot does not say 'EXCUSE ME', Human 3 will remain standing in the group.
tree:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "Human3GiveWayTree">
    <BehaviorTree ID="Human3GiveWayTree">
        <Fallback name="GiveWayOrStayFallback">
            <Sequence name="GiveWaySequence">
                <RobotSays agent_id="{id}" message="4" />
                <SetBlackboard output_key="agentid" value="{id}" />
                <SetBlackboard output_key="timestep" value="{dt}" />
                <Inverter>
                    <IsRobotNearby agent_id="{id}" distance="2.0" />
                </Inverter>
                <GiveWaytoRobot agent_id="{agentid}" time_step="{timestep}" />
            </Sequence>
            <Sequence name="StayInGroup">
                <MakeGesture agent_id="{id}" message="0" />
            </Sequence>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>
